Package it.polimi.se2019.model

Class DominationMatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.model.Match
      • it.polimi.se2019.model.DominationMatch
  • public class DominationMatch
extends Match
    Contains and supports the information for the flow of a Match in domination mode. Supports the SpawnPoints and inserts them after a turn of every player passed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int currentTurn
      Tracks the current turn, used to add the Domination Spawn in the correct moment

      • Fields inherited from class it.polimi.se2019.model.Match

        board, currentPlayer, finalFrenzy, firstPlayer, players, rand, spawnPoints, turnEnd, updateSender

      Create a Domination Match, using Match constructor Initializes Match.spawnPoints with an ArrayList

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean checkFrenzy()
      Check if frenzy can be started Frenzy can start if spawnpoints with >8 damages are equal or more than 2, or if Match.checkFrenzy() is True
      int getCurrentTurn()  
      java.util.List<SpawnPlayer> getSpawnPoints()  
      java.util.List<Player> getWinners()
      Get winners by scoring the players and the spawnPoints, and returning the list of winners Offline players can't be winners
      void insertSpawnPoints()
      Add spawnPoints to the Board, in the following spawn tiles: RED YELLOW BLUE
      boolean newTurn()
      Initializes a new turn in Domination Mode Add damages to Match.currentPlayer if it's on a SpawnPoint Hit the spawnPoint (even if already hit) Insert spawnPoints if second Turn
      void restoreMatch​(Match oldMatch)
      Restores a Domination Match, by setting the current Turn to the current one, avoiding to insert spawnPoints more than once.
      void scoreDeadShot​(Player player)
      Deadshots in domination are not handled, they are just ignored as by rules Reward points are modified, though
      void scoreSpawnPoint​(Player spawnPlayer)
      Score a spawn point ad the end of the game Map the frequency of damages, compare and give points in order to the more frequent shooter Give same points to the n shooter with same frequency, but skip n Player.rewardPoints for the next shooter
      void setCurrentTurn​(int currentTurn)  
      void setSpawnPoints​(java.util.List<SpawnPlayer> spawnPoints)

        public void restoreMatch​(Match oldMatch)
        Restores a Domination Match, by setting the current Turn to the current one, avoiding to insert spawnPoints more than once.
        Overrides:
        restoreMatch in class Match
        Parameters:

      • newTurn

        public boolean newTurn()
        Initializes a new turn in Domination Mode Add damages to Match.currentPlayer if it's on a SpawnPoint Hit the spawnPoint (even if already hit) Insert spawnPoints if second Turn
        Overrides:
        newTurn in class Match
        Returns:
        true if match is finished

      • insertSpawnPoints

        public void insertSpawnPoints()
        Add spawnPoints to the Board, in the following spawn tiles:
      • RED
      • YELLOW
      • BLUE

  • scoreDeadShot

    public void scoreDeadShot​(Player player)
    Deadshots in domination are not handled, they are just ignored as by rules Reward points are modified, though
    Specified by:
    scoreDeadShot in class Match
    Parameters:
    player - player where dead shot is scored

  • getWinners

    public java.util.List<Player> getWinners()
    Get winners by scoring the players and the spawnPoints, and returning the list of winners Offline players can't be winners
    Specified by:
    getWinners in class Match
    Returns:
    list of player declared winner of the game

  • scoreSpawnPoint

    public void scoreSpawnPoint​(Player spawnPlayer)
    Score a spawn point ad the end of the game Map the frequency of damages, compare and give points in order to the more frequent shooter Give same points to the n shooter with same frequency, but skip n Player.rewardPoints for the next shooter
    Parameters:
    spawnPlayer - spawnPoint to score

  • checkFrenzy

    public boolean checkFrenzy()
    Check if frenzy can be started Frenzy can start if spawnpoints with >8 damages are equal or more than 2, or if Match.checkFrenzy() is True
    Overrides:
    checkFrenzy in class Match
    Returns:
    true if frenzy need to start
